infos.value: There is no benefit to simply having an esper in your possession. Let us equip it posthaste.
The greatest characteristic of an esper is its evocation magic.
Let us capitalize on this opportunity and enhance an esper.
You have acquired some SP after your esper leveled up. Let us use this SP to awaken a new ability within the esper.
Among the panels that can be acquired, it appears that some can be used to level up an esper's evocation magic.
You can also reset panels acquired on the Training Board and reacquire them.
It may prove beneficial to swap out certain panels according to your party formation or the enemies you expect to fight.
Your espers will be able to lend you even greater power once they have been awakened.
However, in order to obtain the necessary materials, you must visit the Beast's Den.
I think it is best to take on this challenge only once your units' combined fighting power is more than adequate.
Lastly, allow me to talk about resonance with espers.
If you unequip an esper, your resonance with it will gradually decrease. Do be cognizant of this.
I have prepared the necessary materials, so go ahead and use them.
• Espers •

• Espers •
Equipping an esper will cause a fixed percentage of its stats to be added to the unit...
• Espers II •
...and the esper's <color=#00ffff>resistances</color> will be <color=#00ffff>added</color> to the unit <color=#00ffff>as is</color>.
• Evocation Magic •

• Evocation Magic •
These are powerful abilities wielded by espers. You can learn how to use them in the Beginner's Hall.
• Enhancement •

• Enhancement •
Enhancing an esper requires specific items.
They can mostly be obtained in Chocobo Expedition.
• Esper Training Board •

• Esper Training Board •
You can consume SP acquired after leveling up to unlock panels for various abilities.
• Resetting •

• Resetting •
You can also consume Visiore to reset the Ability Board.
• Resetting II •
The panels will return to <color=#00ffff>a pre-acquired state</color>, and any consumed <color=#00ffff>SP</color> will be <color=#00ffff>recovered</color>.
• Awakening •
Espers can be <color=#00ffff>awakened</color> by training them to their <color=#00ffff>max level</color> and gathering enough <color=#00ffff>specific awakening materials</color>.
• Awakening II •
• Resonance •

<color=#00ffff>Equipping</color> an esper and <color=#00ffff>embarking on battles</color> will increase the <color=#00ffff>resonance</color> between <color=#00ffff>the esper</color> and <color=#00ffff>its unit</color>.
• Resonance II •
When resonance increases, the <color=#00ffff>fixed percentage</color> of the esper's <color=#00ffff>stats</color> that is applied to the unit will <color=#00ffff>increase</color>...
• Resonance III •
...and the <color=#00ffff>effect duration</color> of any evocation magic that induces <color=#00ffff>map effects</color> will also <color=#00ffff>increase</color>.
